channel.title: Thinking In Java on Tony Xu Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Thinking In Java on Tony Xu Blog

item.title: Chapter 1 - Introduction to Objects
item.description: The progress of abstraction Five basic characteristics of object-oriented programming: Everything is an object. A program is a bunch of objects telling each other what to do by sending messages. Each object has its own memory made up of other objects. Every object has a type All objects of a particular type can receive the same messages. An object has an interface The interface determines what request you can make for a particular object.
